org.framed.orm.ui.editPart.connectionkinds

Class ORMRelationshipConstraintEditPart

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eclipse.gef.editparts.AbstractEditPart
      • org.eclipse.gef.editparts.AbstractGraphicalEditPart
        • org.eclipse.gef.editparts.AbstractConnectionEditPart
          • org.framed.orm.ui.editPart.connectionkinds.ORMRelationEditPart
            • org.framed.orm.ui.editPart.connectionkinds.ORMRelationshipConstraintEditPart
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.eclipse.core.runtime.IAdaptable, org.eclipse.gef.ConnectionEditPart, org.eclipse.gef.EditPart, org.eclipse.gef.GraphicalEditPart, org.eclipse.gef.LayerConstants, org.eclipse.gef.RequestConstants
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ORMAcyclicEditPart, ORMIrreflexiveEditPart, ORMTotalEditPart

    public class ORMRelationshipConstraintEditPart
extends ORMRelationEditPart
    This EditPart is the super/parent EditPart also super/parent controller of all RelationshipConstraints and is needed, because all RelationshipConstraints of a Relationship need to be unified in a single figure and when the user deletes/adds a RelationshipConstraint than the figure mus be updated.
    Author:
    Kay Bierzynski

      • creatRelationshipConstraint

        public org.eclipse.draw2d.IFigure creatRelationshipConstraint(String text)
        This method creates and returns the RelationshipConstraint figure, which differs from RelationshipConstraint to RelationshipConstraint only in the text of the Label. A RelationshipConstraint figure is dashed line with a Label.
        Returns:
        conn org.eclipse.draw2d.PolylineConnection

      • refreshVisuals

        public void refreshVisuals()
        The refreshVisuals of this EditPart updates/adds the Bendpoints of a Relation. The content of this method should only be called when the compartment/grouping/compartmentdiagram where this Relations parentrolemodel(for the cases compartment/grouping) belongs to is the current opened(content of the viewer) compartment/grouping/compartmentdiagram. The test of getSource() != null and getTarget() != null is needed, because it exist cases where this method /its called and getSource() or getTarget() returns null. The refreshVisuals of this EditPart calls ORMRelationEditPart.refreshVisuals(), "unifies the RelationshipConstraint figures" of a single Relationship" and sets the visibilitie of the RelationshipConstraint figure. The unifying of the RelationshipConstraint figures is done through combining the text/name of all the RelationshipConstraints in the Label of the RelationshipConstraint figure of the first RelationshipConstraint, which was created for the relationship, and through setting the visibilities of the other RelationshipConstraint figures on false.
        Overrides:
        refreshVisuals in class ORMRelationEditPart
